alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Butte, Blackfoot Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 2:09PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, northern Granite, north central Ravalli and central Powell Counties through 300 PM MST... At 208 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported intense snow showers along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Drummond to 7 miles west of Victor. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Drummond, Stevensville, Victor, Woodside, Pinesdale, Nimrod, Finn, New Chicago, Bearmouth, Quigley, Corvallis, Helmville, Bell Crossing and Hall. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 130 and 158. Highway 93 S between mile markers 48 and 68. Highway 200 E between mile markers 58 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These snow showers may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
